meanings.definition: To twist or contort into the shape of a pretzel.
meanings.sent1: She was pretzelling her body into a yoga pose.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast was pretzelling her limbs during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The contortionist was pretzelling her body in ways that amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches were pretzelling in the wind during the storm.
meanings.sent5: He pretzelled his fingers into intricate shapes while waiting.

meanings.definition: To engage in complex or convoluted reasoning or argumentation.
meanings.sent1: The politician was pretzelling his words to avoid answering the question.
meanings.sent2: She spent hours pretzelling her thoughts to come up with a solution.
meanings.sent3: The students were pretzelling their arguments in the debate club.
meanings.sent4: The detective was pretzelling the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The author was pretzelling the plot to create a surprising twist.

meanings.definition: To perform acrobatic movements or stunts.
meanings.sent1: The circus performer was pretzelling through the air with grace.
meanings.sent2: The acrobat was pretzelling on the tightrope without a safety net.
meanings.sent3: The kids were pretzelling on the playground equipment, showing off their skills.
meanings.sent4: The dancer was pretzelling across the stage in a mesmerizing performance.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was pretzelling over obstacles in the obstacle course race.
